pr_title: SONARJAVA-3416 Rule S5846: Empty lines should not be tested with regex MULTILINE flag

timeline.bodyText: This misses cases where the flag is set slightly differently (e.g. (?m:^$)) or other flags are set (e.g. (?mi)^$).
timeline.author: sebastian-hungerecker-sonarsource

replies.bodyText: Comparing strings like this also won't correctly handle the (?x) or Pattern.COMMENT flag that makes whitespace and comments be ignored inside the regex (i.e. something like Pattern.compile("(?mx)  ^    $") or Pattern.compile(" ^    $", Pattern.MULTILINE | Pattern.COMMENT). Going through the RegexParser will take care of ignoring whitespace and comments when that flag is set.
replies.author: sebastian-hungerecker-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText: This won't correctly identify the flag if multiple flags are used (Pattern.compile(bla, Pattern.MULTILINE | Patter.COMMENT). As it turns out, this is currently broken anyway, but I'm about to submit a PR that makes AbstractRegexCheck correctly handle ORed flags like that.
timeline.author: sebastian-hungerecker-sonarsource
